docs.snippet: CHICAGO, Sept. 11. -- Prof. F.B. Putnam, Chief of the Department of Ethnology and Archaeology of the World's Fair, is rapidly getting together the materials for a grand exhibit. He began the work in February and gathered around him many able...
docs.lead_paragraph: CHICAGO, Sept. 11. -- Prof. F.B. Putnam, Chief of the Department of Ethnology and Archaeology of the World's Fair, is rapidly getting together the materials for a grand exhibit. He began the work in February and gathered around him many able assistants, who are especially qualified for investigations in this direction.
docs.abstract: Nations' Official Acceptances of Invitation to Participate

headline.main: WORKING HARD ON THE FAIR; THE NATIONAL COMMISSION ADJOURNS TILL APRIL. BUT THE WORK IN CHICAGO WILL MOVE ALONG JUST THE SAME -- TEXANS PROTEST AGAINST SUNDAY CLOSING -- OTHER NEWS.

docs.snippet: CHICAGO, Oct. 2. -- Representatives of labor societies are coming to Chicago from all parts of the world to attend the Labor Congress during the World's Fair. T.V. Powderly has been in constant communication with the committee that has this work in...
docs.lead_paragraph: CHICAGO, Oct. 2. -- Representatives of labor societies are coming to Chicago from all parts of the world to attend the Labor Congress during the World's Fair. T.V. Powderly has been in constant communication with the committee that has this work in charge, and will attend all of the conventions. John Burns, a labor member of the London Council and one of the foremost labor leaders of Great Britain, is also coming.
docs.abstract: Laborers Imported by Foreign Exhibitors Not a Violation of Contract Labor Law

headline.main: BIDDERS FOR A SUBSIDY; PROPOSALS MADE FOR TWELVE ONLY OF THE ROUTES. NO TWO APPLICANTS FOR ANY ONE OF THE PROPOSITIONS -- THE MAXIMUM RATE ASKED IN EACH CASE -- LINES COVERED IN YESTERDAY'S BIDS.

docs.snippet: One hundred members of the National Guard, State of New-York, participated in the sharpshooters' match at Creedmoor Saturday for money prizes and the gold marksman's badge given by the National Rifle Association. The latter was won by G.T. Musson of...
docs.lead_paragraph: One hundred members of the National Guard, State of New-York, participated in the sharpshooters' match at Creedmoor Saturday for money prizes and the gold marksman's badge given by the National Rifle Association. The latter was won by G.T. Musson of Company K, Twenty-third Regiment, whose property the badge now becomes, as he has won it three times this year.

headline.main: SHARPSHOOTERS AT CREEDMOOR.; THE GOLD BADGE WON BY G.T. MUSSON -- SCORES OF THE SUCCESSFUL MEN.

docs.snippet: BOSTON, Nov. 9. -- The recommendation of Secretary of Agriculture Rusk that the duty on hides provided for in the reciprocity section of the new tariff law be imposed in all cases where the countries from which such hides are shipped have not granted...
docs.lead_paragraph: BOSTON, Nov. 9. -- The recommendation of Secretary of Agriculture Rusk that the duty on hides provided for in the reciprocity section of the new tariff law be imposed in all cases where the countries from which such hides are shipped have not granted equal concessions does not, apparently, cause much concern to the shoe and leather men of Boston.
docs.abstract: Hides; Duty Should Be Increased; Secretary Rusk's Proposal

headline.main: LEATHER MEN UNCONCERNED.; NOT DISTURBED BY SECRETARY RUSK'S PROPOSAL TO TAX HIDES.
